intro: Fumaria schrammii var. orientalis, commonly known as the Oriental whitlow grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and meadows. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. This variety is native to parts of Asia and has been introduced to other regions as an ornamental or weed species.
